snippet: Paolo Gabriele, the butler, is charged with aggravated theft and accused of taking and then leaking documents from the pope’s private apartment that raised allegations of corruption at the Vatican.
abstract: Judge at the Vatican orders the former papal butler of Pope Benedict XVI to stand trial on charges of taking and then leaking documents from the pope’s private apartment that raised allegations of corruption at the Vatican; accusations against the butler, Paolo Gabriele, are set out in an indictment that, for the first time, accuses a second Vatican employee of involvement; Claudio Sciarpelletti, a computer expert, is charged with aiding and abetting.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Paola Nuvola contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Paolo Gabriele, the butler, is charged with aggravated theft and accused of taking and then leaking documents from the pope’s private apartment that raised allegations of corruption at the Vatican.

headline.seo: Vatican Judge Indicts Pope’s Butler in Leak Case
headline.main: Pope’s Butler Indicted in Vatican Leak Case
headline.print_headline: Pope’s Butler Indicted in Vatican Leak Case
